title: 108_hr1211
content: The Act may be cited as the "State and Local Aid and Economic Stimulus Act of 2003" and includes a one-time revenue grant to states and local governments. The "State and Local Aid and Economic Stimulus Act of 2003" includes a one-time revenue grant of $40 billion to States and local governments for fiscal year 2003. The grant is to be allotted based on population, with $20 billion for States and $10 billion for local governments. The "State and Local Aid and Economic Stimulus Act of 2003" allocates $10 billion to local governments based on population and $20 billion to States based on unemployment rates. The Act allocates $2.5 billion to States with tier 1 unemployment rates for distribution to local governments based on the number of unemployed individuals in each unit. The Act allocates $7.5 billion among States with tier 2 unemployment rates based on the number of unemployed individuals in each State for distribution to local governments. The Act allocates $7.5 billion among States with tier 2 unemployment rates based on the number of unemployed individuals in each State for distribution to local governments. Priority for using the funds should be given to homeland security, medicaid, public health, highway construction, childcare, education, and prevention of property tax increases. Definitions include 'State' as any of the several States, the District of Columbia, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and 'Unit of general local government'. The term 'unit of general local government' includes counties, parishes, townships, cities, political subdivisions, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and recognized governing bodies of Indian tribes or Alaskan native villages with substantial governmental duties and powers. The term 'unit of general local government' includes various types of governmental bodies such as counties, cities, and tribal governing bodies. The rules for determining these units are specified in section 6720(c) of this title. Regarding unemployment rates, tier 1 refers to a rate that is 0.4 to 1.0 percentage points higher in 2002 compared to 2000, while tier 2 is more than 1.0 percentage point higher. The table of sections for chapter 67 of title 31, United States Code, is amended by adding a new item for calendar year 2000. One-time revenue grant to States and local governments.
